source.document_id: Potentially fatal arrhythmia complicating endobronchial epinephrine

metadata.title: Potentially Fatal Arrhythmia Complicating Endobronchial Epinephrine for Control of Iatrogenic Bleeding
metadata.journal: American Journal of Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine

sections.abstract: Letter describing two cases of ventricular fibrillation occurring seconds after endobronchial epinephrine (5 ml, 1:20,000) instillation via guide sheath for severe bleeding during EBUS-guided transbronchial lung biopsy. Both patients had no identified cardiac risk factors, were resuscitated with cardioversion, and recovered. Authors question efficacy and safety of endobronchial epinephrine for biopsy-related bleeding and advise against administering epinephrine into the lung periphery via guide sheath.
sections.methods: Case series of two patients undergoing EBUS-guided TBLB with severe bleeding managed with endobronchial epinephrine via guide sheath. Clinical course, dose, temporal relationship to arrhythmia, and subsequent evaluations reported.
sections.results: Both patients received epinephrine 0.25 mg endobronchially. Ventricular fibrillation developed within seconds, requiring cardioversion (150 J and 250 J). Electrolytes and subsequent cardiac evaluations were normal. No deaths occurred. Authors note literature reports of serious cardiac events with low-dose epinephrine and the rarity of fatal bleeding after TBLB.

population.text: Adults undergoing EBUS-guided transbronchial lung biopsy with significant bleeding.
inclusion_criteria: Underwent EBUS-guided TBLB with guide sheath
Significant bleeding not controlled by suction/tamponade
exclusion_criteria: Known pre-existing risk factors for fatal arrhythmia (none reported in cases)

intervention.details: Instillation of 5 ml epinephrine 1:20,000 (0.25 mg) into the lung periphery at the bleeding site during EBUS-TBLB.

comparison.details: No concurrent control group; descriptive case series.

arms.name: Endobronchial epinephrine via guide sheath during EBUS-TBLB bleeding

provenance.quote: Within 5 seconds, a narrow QRS complex tachycardia developed, and over 15 seconds, the ECG deteriorated into ventricular fibrillation (VF)… Within seconds, VF developed.

outcomes_normalized.name: Restoration of sinus rhythm by cardioversion

provenance.quote: Sinus rhythm was restored within 3 minutes by cardioversion (150 J)… Restoration of sinus rhythm was achieved by direct cardioversion (250 J).
ECG subsequently demonstrated no abnormalities… subsequent lobectomy was uneventful… Left heart catheterization demonstrated normal findings.

safety_normalized.management: Electrical cardioversion (150 J in case 1; 250 J in case 2) with restoration of sinus rhythm.

domains.name: Selection bias
domains.support_for_judgment: Uncontrolled case series of 2 cases without comparator.

retrieval.summary_tldr: In a 2-patient case series, ventricular fibrillation occurred seconds after endobronchial epinephrine (0.25 mg) via guide sheath for TBLB bleeding; both were cardioverted. Authors advise against epinephrine instillation into the lung periphery.
retrieval.clinical_relevance: Highlights potentially fatal arrhythmia risk from endobronchial epinephrine during bronchoscopy and supports preference for iced saline and tamponade over epinephrine in managing TBLB bleeding.
